byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and Ashley Southall contributed reporting.

abstract: Hate crimes are on rise in New York City following Donald Trump's victory in presidential election; 43 episodes have been reported since Election Day, more than double number reported for same period in 2015.

headline.print_headline: Finding Hate Crimes on the Rise, Leaders Condemn Vicious Acts
headline.main: Finding Hate Crimes on the Rise, Leaders Condemn Vicious Acts

snippet: Hate crimes in New York City have risen in the weeks since Donald J. Trump won the presidential election. The incidents range from vicious graffiti to physical violence....
lead_paragraph: Hate crimes in New York City have risen in the weeks since Donald J. Trump won the presidential election. The incidents range from vicious graffiti to physical violence.
